alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Montgomery; Treutlen (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Emanuel, southeastern Treutlen and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Garfield to Stillmore to near Normantown, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Swainsboro, Twin City, Stillmore, Oak Park, Garfield, Nunez, Modoc, Canoochee, Lexsy and George L Smith State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
